channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Footpath is impassable, 21st June
item.description:
Hello, The hedge on this stretch of Lobleys Drive is now so overgrown that it is impossible to walk along it, and one must walk on the verge to get past. Can it be cut back please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Pippin Close, Abbeymead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in East end of Swindon Village Hall car park ., 21st June
item.description:
Pothole is steadily growing and is currently 110mm diameter and 50mm depth.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 28 Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in East end of Swindon Village Hall car park, 21st June
item.description:
This pothole measures 800mm diameter, 80mm depth with cracks extending to 2100mm diameter. Has been steadily growing for the last year or two.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reddings Road, 21st June
item.description:
This road has straddle holes dug cutting across the road, from Grovefield way, right through to Hatherley Lane (i gather up to Unwin Road entrance as well.). With that, there are a number of potholes. This continues to blight Cars, buses, bicycles, and motorbikes, (even wheelchairs have obstructions crossing the road). It's worth bearing these later items to realise the danger, swerves, etc which may occur. This road has been in this state for years (maybe a decade) and needs attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Bramley The Reddings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sink hole, 19th June
item.description:
A sink hole has appeared on the corner of Mottershead Drive & Luke Lane. This is a very busy path as next to a school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 59 Mottershead Drive, Innsworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Railings bent restricting access, 19th June
item.description:
The railings have been hit by a vehicle and are now bent making it difficult to get round using a pram/cycle/wheelchair. The railings are at the side of parton Manor school down the small access road behind the library
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elm Close Parton Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath blocked from overgrowth, 19th June
item.description:
Plant growth has blocked the footpath. Pedestrians cannot walk on the pavement so no chance for a wheelchair or pram

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 85 Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely long grass, 19th June
item.description:
Please could you look to cut the grass on middle carriageway, so long it is difficult to see if car coming down road as you cross carriageway by 12 bells beefeater.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Ermin Way, Witcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of white lines, 18th June
item.description:
On approaches to and on roundabout lack of white lines indicating lanes and arrows indicating which lane to be I. This causes problems for vehicles entering the roundabout not knowing whether vehicles on roundabout are leaving roundabout, or travelling around to next exit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Northfield House Shurdington Road, Bentham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sign pointing wrong direction, 18th June
item.description:
Road sign to Leckhampton on A46 on opposite end of leckhampton Lane is obscured by hedge and is pointing towards Cheltenham
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Little Hills Shurdington Road, Shurdington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstacles on road, 18th June
item.description:
Large concrete balls have been placed on the verge very close to the tarmac. Highways made a neighbouring property (The Elms) remove similar balls placed on the verge as they were a hazard to traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Part Parcel 5200 Dog Lane, Bentham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road in v poor condition, 17th June
item.description:
Some of it has been fixed but some of it left - very uncomfortable for cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): One Bayshill Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road in v poor condition, 17th June
item.description:
By roundabout. Please could you fix it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Montpellier Exchange Montpellier Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smith's old housing estate Bishopscleeve, 17th June
item.description:
I have been in the old part of the village ie linworth road, tobyfield road , surrounding area bishopscleeve, after Smith's, then a few housing associations have always kept the grass verges and areas tidy , but now its atrocious, I don't no why but some residents still pay ground maintenance in there agreements, so why has it got so bad, infact The areas that Highways own all over the county is overgrown over the country from higham to Stanton, I have never seen the county so overgrown and dangerous to road users ,its shameful

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 44 Linworth Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verges Overgrown, 17th June
item.description:
This section of the road is narrow anyway but with overgrown hedges on one side it makes it a problem for traffic to pass in both directions. The hedges need cutting/trimming back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road full of debris, 17th June
item.description:
This section of the whole road needs sweeping. It is full of debris (stones, sticks etc..), if we get heavy rain it will wash this debris (on a slope) down and block the drains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long deep persistent pothole, 17th June
item.description:
This part of the road is crumbling away and as a result a long deep, becoming deeper pothole has/is occurring. It is a serious hazard, the road is narrow and you cannot swerve the pot hole if there is oncoming traffic. This pothole would damage your car
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12cm deep pothole, 17th June
item.description:
This pothole is deep at least 12cm and approaching it downhill is a dangerous hazard. If you run into it you could seriously damage your car. At one point a cone had been put in the hole to forewarn you but the cone has been removed but the pothole remains. I feel this needs urgent attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lilleybrook Golf Club, 313 Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12‚Äù pothole on T junction, 17th June
item.description:
This pothole has been here since the winter and getting bigger. It is on the actual t junction and is a particular problem when entering Elkstone from the Cheltenham side.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 17th June
item.description:
More large rubbish bags dumped in the verge and other bags and bits of pieces along this road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet
